posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
http://world-of-greyhawk.github.io/buil ... 87185.html

One cannot take Epic Dodge at that level - it needs to be fixed (Tumble 30 requirement means mind. level 27).  This is an old build, based on a NWN version that was before the patch that changed ED.

posts.author: Pan Draconis
posts.content: Take Great dex at level 24 and epic dodge at level 27 without any other change ?

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content: Yep, that's what I did, I just was pointing out that this old build needs updating.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Just a personal opinion here, but I'd be tempted to take EWS at level 21 as a general feat, regain the Dex point at level 40 instead of Wis (the Will save's sucky anyway - 17 - so losing 1 more will make no real difference), which leaves a spare WM bonus feat at level 39 that can be used for either Epic Prowess or Armour Skin.

Also, 43 (42) in UMD is redundant: at most it should be 41 (40), giving you a whole 2 skill points to play with! Actually, if you take 4 points from Open Locks as well, then add the 6 to Disable Trap you get 37 (38), giving you full disarm epic traps. That said, I'm not terribly sure what Discipline brings to the build, but I'm probably missing something.

(Just trying to prove that I do read this stuff!)

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I am actually making use of the Discipline on WoG, as this build is my template for Birdie, my kenku.  She uses a light pickaxe...her "pecker" :D

Hehe...see, Conlaoch?  That's how you get away with using words like that!

Anyways, since opponents on WoG love to do Disarm against small and tiny weapons, Discipline is an important skill to oppose this.

Always good to have WoG tips, thanks! And at least it didn't open up Ye Olde Discipline for Dexers debate again, thank the gods.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
There are many old builds that won't work properly anymore because the rules have changed over time.
And it would be too much to ask of anyone to go back and fix them all.

Nevertheless, if there are any builds of special interest, such as this one, it would be fine if someone familiar with it took the time, doing us the favour and reposting a working version of it here, either in the unfinalized section or in the 40s, depending on how well documented it is.
The original poster must be credited, of course. And it would also be fair to link to the original build, like you have done here Web!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I'm not trying to be that person, but...

Mick, it's not like everyone here is just overworked producing builds, right?

I mean, this topic and thread alone shows that we all have the time and ability to actually fix these, once awareness is brought to it.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Heh.

I am busy tho - I have my Lore responsibilities over at the WoG forum, among other things.  And I still find time to bring attention to these things.

And I have already "fixed" it - I am playing this build. 

So, let us be absolutely candid here, shall we?

Yeah, that's certainly going to be an encouraging aspect of things, isn't it?

Yeah, that's certainly going to be an encouraging aspect of things, isn't it?

Guess there's going to be even more enui here.

See ya!
The lore forum on WoG currently stands at 10 entries in 7 months - one of which is the introduction and another is a country mile from completion (notable persons) - so don't try to play that "I'm too busy" card with me. Don't get me wrong, I do like what you're doing there, but the whiff of burning martyr is a tad acrid.

And no, no one said all builds will be "saddled" on you. However, these are old builds, many constructed before the 1.69 patch came out, and all of them before this Guild existed. While caveat emptor applies here, when members have questions about any builds from the old site, we have always helped resolve those issues.

So thanks for the negativity, but it might be worth looking at who's casting the first stone.

Oh, and this is me locking this topic. Happy New Year.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
I'm not putting saddles or any other burdens on anybody. There is no "have to do" here.
I simply suggest how we can share old builds that we have modified to meet current standards.

Pointing at an old build offers a fine opportunity to do just that.
